text: this is a safe house for women who fled
violence at the hands of their own
families Anisa not her real name is in
hiding from her parents they threatened
to kill her because they believe she
shamed the family honor by leaving her
violent husband if your parents found
you what do you think the consequences
would be I think they would hurt me I
think they could possibly kill me
what makes you think your family may
kill you if they found you people are
pointing fingers at them people are
saying that I was a bad person so I'm
really scared they're gonna find me and
they're gonna take me back and if I
refuse that they'll kill me
so-called honor crimes mainly occur in
South Asian Middle Eastern and North
African communities where a woman's
behavior can be seen as key to
preserving a family's honor
since 2010 more than 11,000 cases of
honour based violence have been recorded
by police in the UK last year alone
there were more than 2,000 incidents
these include abductions beatings and
even murders with us campaigners believe
this is a growing problem we need to
break the silence of the community we
need to isolate those who are practicing
honor killing who are beating up their
children who are forcing their children
into marriage do you see the situation
getting any better it will get better if
we have a national strategy plan for all
the out services because on a base
violence is about life and death
it's thought other figures don't show
the full extent of the issue many honor
crimes are going unreported because the
perpetrators are usually the victims own
families
Divya tawa BBC News
